D001.description: Ignitable waste - liquids with flash point <60°C (140°F), non-liquid capable of causing fire through friction/absorption of moisture, ignitable compressed gas, or oxidizer

D002.description: Corrosive waste - aqueous solution with pH ≤2 or ≥12.5, or liquid that corrodes steel at rate >6.35mm/year at 55°C

D003.description: Reactive waste - unstable, reacts violently with water, forms explosive mixtures, generates toxic gases, or is capable of detonation

D004.description: Toxicity characteristic for Arsenic - TCLP extract ≥5.0 mg/L

D005.description: Toxicity characteristic for Barium - TCLP extract ≥100.0 mg/L

D006.description: Toxicity characteristic for Cadmium - TCLP extract ≥1.0 mg/L

D007.description: Toxicity characteristic for Chromium - TCLP extract ≥5.0 mg/L

D008.description: Toxicity characteristic for Lead - TCLP extract ≥5.0 mg/L

D009.description: Toxicity characteristic for Mercury - TCLP extract ≥0.2 mg/L

D010.description: Toxicity characteristic for Selenium - TCLP extract ≥1.0 mg/L

D011.description: Toxicity characteristic for Silver - TCLP extract ≥5.0 mg/L

D018.description: Toxicity characteristic for Benzene - TCLP extract ≥0.5 mg/L

D019.description: Toxicity characteristic for Carbon tetrachloride - TCLP extract ≥0.5 mg/L

D022.description: Toxicity characteristic for Chloroform - TCLP extract ≥6.0 mg/L

_disclaimer: Only D, P, and U wastes can be determined based on characteristics or constituent presence. F and K codes require generator process knowledge.
